Ashridge

Triathlon England National Championship

After completing an earlier (less congested) version of the Ashridge Duathlon in January and then finding out that i could potentially qualify for the 2020 European Championships as an age grouper i decided to do it all over again, this time it would be much more competitve but im going to give it my best shot.

Ashridge again

ETU Standard Distance Duathlon 2020 European Championship Qualifier

Training and taper plan

???

As this became a short term target of mine i stopped with all the swim training as i only need run and bike. In terms of training i managed to get in a good number of speed sessions for running and for the bike i got in a lot of virtual training sessions at the gym, over the course of a couple of weeks i have gone from speed training at 15kmph to 16kmph and taken my average watts over and hour on the bike from 160ish to 180ish.

Penultimate week - intense (around 14hrs of training)
  • 2hrs on watt bike + Speed training
  • 1.5hrs on watt bike + LISS cardio * 2
  • 1hrs on watt bike + Speed training * 3
Final week - taper (around 7hrs of training)
  • Ashridge bike route x 4 loops + 10km run on treadmill
  • Ashridge bike route x 3 loops + 7.5km run on treadmill
  • Ashridge bike route x 2 loops + 5km run on treadmill
  • Do nothing up to the event

During the final week into the event on what was supposed to be a medium pace 4 loops of the Ashridge route i fell off my bike quite badly and injured nearly every part of the right hand side of my body (see injury list), this meant i couldn`t finish my training plan completely but worst of all i now have the `fear`, i worry i may end up holding back on the day at certain points on the bike due the accident.

Nutrition on the day and beforehand

???

Having done the event before i found that after the 10km run and start of the bike my legs felt heavy, i think the issue was i didn`t take any calories with my on the run so my legs were slightly depleted once i jumped on, this time i will be taking a sports drink to sip on every 2.5km lap, on the bike i will have another sports drink and will use every 5km and also an energy gel to take right at the very start. For the final 5km i will take the same bottle from the 10km to hydrate around the last 2 laps. I will start the day with a big bowl of porridge.

  • Porridge
  • 2 x lucozade drinks
  • 1 x energy gel

Equipment for the event

???

  • Tri suit
  • Nike running trainers
  • Giant TCR road bike
  • Garmin 730xt

How it went on the day

???

Got to the event bright and early and you could tell straight away it was much more serious than the previous time i entered, not only was it a BTU Qualifier event it was also a Triathlon England Championship, which meant there were a lot of very good athletes there.

Overall i came in about 5 minutes quicker which i was very pleased with, improving on each element except for the initial 10km run where i lost around 40 seconds of time. My bike loops were around 23.5 minutes each (compared to 24.75 minutes previously) and my final 5km which felt a lot easier than before was just over 30 seconds faster. I also managed to claw back around 30 seconds in time from the transitions.

The result

???

I managed to finish 113th with a time of 02:43:25 (see result here), so even though i went faster than before i went from winning my age group to coming 16th out of 20 which shows just how much better the competitors were this time. Having looked at the finishers and comparing to Ashridge on the 6th January the fastest time for my age category (30-34) went from a 02:48:23 (me, on the 6th Jan) to a 02:05:42 and the average went from a 03:08:48 to a 02:28:46 (so i wasnt even near that) . I also noticed that within the top 10, 6 came from my category and of the top 20, 8 were in my group. .

Comparison

January 6th vs January 26th

To show how different the level was between a "normal" duathlon event and a national championship.

  6th Jan 26th Jan Difference
10km run 00:43:19 00:43:58 + 00:00:39
T1 00:02:05 00:01:44 - 00:00:21
44km bike 01:39:14 01:34:30 - 00:04:44
T2 00:01:08 00:01:11 - 00:00:03
5km run 00:22:34 00:21:58 - 00:00:36
Total 02:48:23 02:43:25 - 00:04:58
Under the hood
Markup

A mix of flat HTML and Handlebars partials, Handlebars allow for better reuse of code through templating.

Styles

Bootstrap with mdbootstrap theme on top and then further expanded with my own bespoke styling.

JS

Use of jQuery and vanilla JS, also use of some libraries such as lazyload.js and wow.js.

Data

Most content is inline but specific data points are being pulled from my Strava account, I recieve the data in json format and then perfom a number of JS functions before appending to the page.

Imagery

Images have been cropped or resized to specific dimensions, they have been saved as .jpg, optimised using tinypng and then I am lazyloading them in to reduce page weight.

Other

Main framework is mdbootstrap to speed up build. Gulp has been used for task automation and Git with Github is being used for version control and backup.
